meanings.definition: A rare genetic condition characterized by accelerated aging in children.
meanings.sent1: Children with progeria age faster than usual.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are studying progeria to understand how it affects children.
meanings.sent3: The progeria kids may look old, but they have young hearts.
meanings.sent4: Time seems to have a fast-forward button for those with progeria.
meanings.sent5: Progeria is like a movie on fast forward, but in real life.

meanings.definition: The premature aging of cells or tissues.
meanings.sent1: Progeria can cause cells to age before their time.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are researching ways to slow down progeria in cells.
meanings.sent3: The progeria of the skin made it look like a wrinkled shirt.
meanings.sent4: The effects of progeria on cells are like a clock ticking too quickly.
meanings.sent5: The premature aging caused by progeria is a race against time.
